page.title: 09EDUCATION
page.content: {Craigievar School as seen by the {pupils} Craigievar School is 106 years old. There are 30 pupils. The building used to be a County Library. There are two permanent teachers and five itinerant teachers for music, art, drama, physical education and home economics. Our uniform is a grey skirt or trousers, a green, grey and maroon tie, a green shirt and grey pullover. The annual sports and prize giving are held in the adjoining field and is attended by our parents. We go to school at 9.00a.m., have lunch in school from 12.30 to 1.30p.m. and go home at 3.30. The house adjoining our school, now privately owned, was occupied by previous Head Teachers. We sometimes perform concerts for parents and members of the local community.
